> 
> There was nothing new to talk about, what with the lead devs on holiday for the last week. The only thing they missed out that *might* have been "dev note-ish" was "testing continues. No news on the development front. Harv and Mu are back from holiday!

For there being "nothing new to talk about", then why does [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/345-KSP-and-Unity-5) exist?

And it was posted by one of those guys that just got back.

> 
> For there being "nothing new to talk about", then why does [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/345-KSP-and-Unity-5) exist?
> And it was posted by one of those guys that just got back.

It exists because a fair number of grown adults were acting like little brats, jumping to false conclusions inside their own echo chamber, and generally throwing a temper tantrum over the PS4 port announcement because they want KSP to remain PC exclusive.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> \*Pulls out torch and pitchfork and starts chanting
> In all seriousness, I hope it soon does. KSP on OSX has more lag and instability than I could imagine. Ples Squad..
> 
> 
> 
> Is there a Mac 64-bit version?

Just one more reason (on the pile of them) that I'm glad I don't own anything made by Apple. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

There isn't even a 64-bit Windows version. That was abandoned some time ago. It may get resurrected with the migration to U5, which handles it much better.

> 
> It exists because a fair number of grown adults were acting like little brats...

The proposition was put forth "There is no dev notes post *because* there is no information."

This is demonstrated false by the fact that the next day, a large post containing new information was made.

But that's okay. You sure used the opportunity to stick it to those people that might want to express their opinion that they think Squad has made some bad decisions. What right do they have to speak?![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
Let's stay away from commenting on the character of other posters, please. It adds nothing to the conversation and only makes for hard feelings.

After reading HarvesteR's post, I feel a little better about this. I'm still disheartened by the lack of acknowledgement of OS X issues, and it would be nice if we could get even something along the lines of "We know the OS X version has major issues. We're working on it." I wouldn't say I'm a huge gamer by any stretch, but of the games I do play from time to time, none of them involve anticipating crashes as part of gameplay. When you load a game, you just expect it to work until you're done playing it, and crashes should be few and far between... they should be out of the ordinary. I mean, people have actually built entire mods to help you predict when you're going to crash next, so you can save your game before that point, so this isn't just an OS X issue, but we seem to be hardest hit by it. If I were Squad, dealing with that issue would be first and foremost. 

That being said, I think I agree with the general consensus... as long as KSP for PS4 doesn't do to KSP what Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel did to that franchise, then best of luck with it.
Just read harvesters post. Sounds really good. Hopefully in the 'lots of stuff being rewritten from the ground up' some longstanding bugs may well just go away as a part of the process.

> > > [**Find out more about KSP on PS4 here, from our very own Maxmaps!**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/344-Kerbal-Space-Program-is-coming-to-PlayStation-4-What-does-that-mean-for-you) > > [**And find out what HarvesteR has been up to with Unity5!**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/345-KSP-and-Unity-5) Um... Finish existing game and promised features first? A game like this will not sell well on consoles, let's face it. . . The average console gamer just won't be interested.
